newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey extends pay deadline in key bank sell-off.
newsitem.headline: Turkey extends pay deadline in key bank sell-off.

text.p: Turkey's Privatisation Administration (OIB) has extended the deadline for the down payment in the sale of the government's second bank to be privatised, officials said on Tuesday.

They said the OIB put the new deadline to June 13 from June 6 for the $74 million in down payment by the buyer of Etibank, sold in March to a textile producer, Dogan Kumascilik, through an open auction tender.
Officials did not say why the buyer had not made the initial payment but indicated the deadline might not be extended for a second time.
Analysts said if Dogan Kumascilik failed to pay, the OIB could decide to sell the bank to the second best bidder, Diler Holding, which offered a close price of $181 at the tender.
They also said the tender could be cancelled and the bank might be re-offered for sell-off from the scratch.
"The decision on how to go ahead if the sale is not realised will be made by the High Board of Privatisation (OYK)," said one official.
The OYK, chaired by Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan, has the authority to award the second or the third bidder respectively, or renew the sell-off tender.
The government privatised Sumerbank, the first bank to be sold-off, for $103.5 million to a textiles and brewer company in 1995.
